channel.title: CyberNetSec - Latest Cybersecurity Articles
channel.description: Latest cybersecurity threat intelligence articles from the past 3 days

item.title: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania and the University of Phoenix have both reported data breaches resulting from the exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities in their Oracle E-Business Suite servers. The attacks have compromised the personal information of at least 1,488 individuals at UPenn and a much ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: White House Sets 2025 Deadline for Post-Quantum Crypto Readiness
item.description:
The White House has issued a new Executive Order to accelerate the U.S. federal government's transition to post-quantum cryptography (PQC). The order sets a critical deadline of December 1, 2025, for several key initiatives. It directs CISA and the NSA to create and maintain a list of commercially a...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign
item.description:
A new malware campaign, tracked as STAC3150, is targeting banking users in Brazil by using WhatsApp Web as a distribution vector for the Astaroth banking trojan. The attack begins with a social engineering lure sent via WhatsApp, which persuades the victim to download a malicious ZIP archive. The ar...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: SharePoint Flaw Chain Exploited to Deploy Warlock Ransomware
item.description:
A new attack campaign attributed to the threat actor Storm-2603 is exploiting a chain of Microsoft SharePoint vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704) for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deploy Velociraptor, a legitimate digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, f...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Vulnerability, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious Go Packages Impersonating Google UUID Library Steal Data
item.description:
A sophisticated and long-running supply chain attack targeting Go developers has been discovered, active since at least May 2021. The attack involves two malicious packages, `github.com/bpoorman/uuid` and `github.com/bpoorman/uid`, which impersonate a popular Google UUID library using a typosquattin...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Mexico's Maguen Group Launches Global Cybersecurity Brand 'Fortem'
item.description:
Maguen Group, a leading private security firm based in Mexico, has officially launched Fortem Cybersecurity, its new global cybersecurity brand, on December 7, 2025. The new entity is an evolution of the company's existing cybersecurity arm, MT Cyber, which it acquired in 2019. With Fortem, Maguen G...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Other

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious Rust Package 'evm-units' Targets Web3 Developers
item.description:
A malicious software package named 'evm-units' has been discovered and removed from Rust's official crates.io registry. The package, downloaded over 7,200 times, targeted Web3 developers by impersonating a legitimate utility for the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). While appearing functional, the cra...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Wireshark Vulnerabilities Create Denial-of-Service Risk for Security Teams
item.description:
France's national cybersecurity agency, CERT-FR, has issued a security advisory for two critical vulnerabilities in Wireshark, the world's most popular network protocol analyzer. The flaws, identified as CVE-2025-13945 and CVE-2025-13946, can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a denial-of-se...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cloudflare Outage Hits 28% of Global Traffic After Faulty React2Shell Patch
item.description:
Cloudflare, a leading internet infrastructure provider, experienced a 25-minute global outage on December 5, 2025, that impacted approximately 28% of its HTTP traffic and made numerous popular websites inaccessible. The company quickly confirmed the disruption was not a cyberattack but was self-infl...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: AI Infrastructure at Risk: MCP Servers Emerge as New Supply Chain Threat
item.description:
A new security advisory warns that Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers represent a significant and growing supply chain risk for organizations building AI-powered applications. These servers act as highly privileged automation engines, often possessing trusted access to sensitive enterprise resourc...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran Bans Officials From Using All Internet-Connected Devices Over Espionage Fears
item.description:
In a drastic measure to combat espionage, Iran's Cybersecurity Command has banned all government officials and their security staff from using any device connected to public communication networks. The directive, reported on December 5, 2025, includes smartphones, laptops, and smartwatches. The move...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: New "Benzona" Ransomware Strain Discovered in the Wild
item.description:
Security researchers at CYFIRMA have discovered a new ransomware strain named "Benzona." The malware encrypts files on Windows, macOS, and Linux systems, appending a ".benzona" extension and dropping a ransom note titled "RECOVERY_INFO.txt". Victims are instructed to use the TOR browser to access a ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Ransomware, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical 7-Zip RCE Vulnerability Now Under Active Exploitation
item.description:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in the popular 7-Zip file archiver, tracked as CVE-2025-11001, is now being actively exploited in the wild. The path traversal flaw, which affects versions prior to 25.0.0, can be triggered when a user extracts a specially crafted malicious archiv...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →
